org.gbif.crawler

Class CrawlContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.crawler.CrawlContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScientificNameRangeCrawlContext

    public class CrawlContext
extends Object
    Base class for any crawl context object. These objects are supposed to hold the mutable state of a running crawl which is needed for the specific strategy in question (e.g. upper and lower bounds for scientific name range based crawls).

    Every crawl we do will always have to support paging and we need an offset for that. This offset needs to be greater than or equal to 0.

      • getOffset

        public int getOffset()

      • setOffset

        public final void setOffset(int offset)
        Sets the offset to a valid positive value (greater than or equal to 0).
        Parameters:
        offset - the new offset

      • isAborted

        public boolean isAborted()
        Returns true if the crawl should be aborted. Once this returns true it can never return false again.
        Returns:
        whether this crawl should be aborted

      • abort

        public void abort()
        This lets us abort a running crawl. Once aborted it can't be undone. There is no guarantee as to how long it takes to actually stop the crawl.

      • isSpeculative

        public boolean isSpeculative()
        Indicates whether the last request we made was a speculative one.
        Returns:
        true if the next request to make (corresponding to this context) is a speculative one

      • setSpeculative

        public void setSpeculative(boolean speculative)

      • getLastContentHash

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Long> getLastContentHash()
        A hash of the last content we received. To be used to detect duplicate content and prevent infinite looping. This is not the hash of the request corresponding to this context but to the last successful one before this.

      • setLastContentHash

        public void setLastContentHash(com.google.common.base.Optional<Long> lastContentHash)
